metadata.description: Essential daily life verbs - reflexive verbs and common actions

present.spanish: Te sientas en el sillón más cómodo de la casa.
present.english: You (vos) sit in the most comfortable chair in the house.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Te sientas siempre en el mismo lugar del café.
present.english: You (informal) always sit in the same spot at the café.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te sientas en la sala para tomar tu café.
present.english: You (informal) sit in the living room to drink your coffee.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Siempre te sientas en la misma mesa para estudiar.
present.english: You (informal) always sit at the same table to study.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te sientas un rato después de llegar a casa.
present.english: You (informal) sit down for a bit after getting home.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me siento en la silla.
present.english: I sit in the chair.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te sientas cerca de la ventana.
present.english: You (informal) sit near the window.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Nos sentamos juntos.
present.english: We sit together.
present.subject: nosotros

preterite.spanish: Me senté en la sala de espera durante dos horas.
preterite.english: I sat in the waiting room for two hours.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se sentó a reflexionar sobre su futuro.
preterite.english: He sat down to reflect on his future.
preterite.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me senté en el sofá.
preterite.english: I sat on the sofa.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te sentaste al lado mío.
preterite.english: You (informal) sat next to me.
preterite.subject: tú

future.spanish: Nos sentaremos a discutir el trabajo mañana.
future.english: We will sit down to discuss the work tomorrow.
future.subject: nosotros

future.spanish: Me sentaré a estudiar después de cenar.
future.english: I will sit down to study after dinner.
future.subject: yo

present-progressive.english: You (informal) are sitting down very slowly.
present-progressive.subject: tú

going-to.english: I am going to sit here.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to sit with me.
going-to.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te acuestas después de ver las noticias.
present.english: You (vos) go to bed after watching the news.
present.subject: vos

present.spanish: Nos acostamos después de leer un rato.
present.english: We go to bed after reading for a while.
present.subject: nosotros

present.spanish: Te acuestas temprano los lunes porque trabajas temprano.
present.english: You (informal) go to bed early on Mondays because you (informal) work early.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Normalmente te acuestas viendo videos en tu teléfono.
present.english: You (informal) usually go to bed watching videos on your phone.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Te acuestas tarde cuando hace mucho calor.
present.english: You (informal) go to bed late when it's really hot.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Me acuesto temprano.
present.english: I go to bed early.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te acuestas tarde.
present.english: You (informal) go to bed late.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Se acuesta a las diez.
present.english: He goes to bed at ten.
present.subject: él

preterite.spanish: Me acosté muy tarde porque tenía mucho trabajo.
preterite.english: I went to bed very late because I had a lot of work.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Te acostaste temprano para estar fresco mañana.
preterite.english: You (vos) went to bed early to feel rested tomorrow.
preterite.subject: vos

quality.fix_issue: English translation slightly unnatural ('to be fresh tomorrow')

preterite.spanish: Me acosté a medianoche.
preterite.english: I went to bed at midnight.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se acostó muy cansado.
preterite.english: He went to bed very tired.
preterite.subject: él

future.english: I will go to bed earlier starting tomorrow.
future.subject: yo

future.spanish: Te acostarás cuando termines la tarea.

present-progressive.subject: él

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to go to bed early.

present.spanish: La jefa despierta a los estudiantes temprano.
present.english: The boss wakes the students up early.

present.english: I wake up at six in the morning every day.

present.english: You (informal) wake up early even on weekends.

present.english: I wake up at seven.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Te despiertas con el sol.
present.english: You (informal) wake up with the sun.
present.subject: tú

present.spanish: Se despierta muy temprano.
present.english: He wakes up very early.

preterite.spanish: Me desperté sobresaltado por el ruido.
preterite.english: I woke up startled by the noise.

preterite.spanish: Se despertó en el hospital sin recordar nada.
preterite.english: He woke up in the hospital remembering nothing.

preterite.spanish: Me desperté a las seis.
preterite.english: I woke up at six.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Se despertó con ruido.
preterite.english: He woke up from noise.

preterite.english: He dressed in black for the funeral.

present.english: I get up at six in the morning.
present.subject: yo
